message: Javascript Optimization/Performance Question: JSLint is advising me to use "if statement" instead of "Switch".  Please comment saying Why to use it or Not.
story: Mohamed Alaa El Din created a poll in Egyptian Geeks.

data.message: I use both, definitely it is not that important, JS compressors/minifiers and browser interpreters may do these similar optimization stuff for you if it really matters

I usually use switch. It has a very slight performance gain over if statements. Please also take into consideration that it will depend on how you write the consecutive if statements; If you write consecutive if statements without using else, then the test will be executed in all cases while using switch will only evaluate the test once or in the worst case, it will stop upon finding the correct test.

It will not make a difference if you use few case or your code is executed only a few times. Unless you put the conditional statements in a 100k loop :D.

More information can be found here:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2922948/javascript-switch-vs-if-else-if-else

Don't worry bro i don't put the condition in a 100K loop :D ta3lemak ya excellence :D I asked the question because i was using Switch normal but the fuckin JSLint is tell me to replace it with an if statement!
it depends on situation , for me  i prefer to use switch with big cases , any way benchmark your code and you will find the best
